atst.giss.abplc

Class PlcioPcFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • atst.giss.abplc.PlcioPcFormat

  • public abstract class PlcioPcFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract class PlcioPcFormat contains constants and helper methods used when operating with PLCIO pcFormat strings. PLCIO uses the pcFormat string to describe the data types contained in a PLC tag so that it can correctly encode/decode PLC tag data. The abplc package uses the same format string to communicate tag data information between collaborating objects.

    Each different data type contained in the PLC tag is described in a PLCIO pcFormat string using the format:

    • <typeId>[optional length in bytes]
    The typeId may be one of the following:
    • c — char, of length 1 byte
    • i — short, of length 2 bytes
    • j — int, of length 4 bytes
    • q — long (or quad), of length 8 bytes
    • r — real, of length 4 bytes
    • d — double, of length 8 bytes
    A pcFormat string is composed of one or more of the above typeId and optional length pairs, and in the abplc package this is termed a type descriptor of the pcFormat string. Using the optional byte length means that a single type descriptor describes data contained in multiple occurrences of the same type, the term member is used to reference the individual data contained in each type occurrence.

    The class PlcioPcFormatType is used to store information about individual type descriptors of a pcFormat string. Therefore, numerous objects of this class may be instantiated to store information about all the data contained in a complete pcFormat string. The Java ArrayList collection is the most suitable structure for storing all PlcioPcFormatType objects relating to a complete pcFormat string, as the order in which they are contained in the string must be maintained for correct encoding/decoding of PLC tags.

      NB In PLCIO the type of char has length 1 byte but a type of Java char has length 2 bytes.

      • BYTE_LEN_C

        public static final int BYTE_LEN_C
        The length in bytes used by PLCIO for type char = 1 byte.
        NB In PLCIO the type of char has length 1 byte but a type of Java char has length 2 bytes. We are interested in how PLCIO represents a char and so give it length 1 byte.

      • getPlcioPcFormatStrTotalBytes

        public static int getPlcioPcFormatStrTotalBytes(java.lang.String pcFormatStr)
                                         throws ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties
        Class method to calculate the total byte length of the given PLCIO pcFormat string.
        Parameters:
        pcFormatStr - The pcFormat string from which the total bytes contained in the string are to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The total number of bytes described by the pcFormat string.
        Throws:
        ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties - -- if the tag has bad properties

      • plcioPcFormatStr2ArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<atst.giss.abplc.PlcioPcFormatType> plcioPcFormatStr2ArrayList(java.lang.String pcFormatStr)
                                                                                         throws ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties
        Class method to create a Java ArrayList of PlcioPcFormatType objects that describes all data contained in a PLCIO pcFormat string.
        Parameters:
        pcFormatStr - The pcFormat string from which all type descriptions will be extracted and used to create an ArrayList of PlcioPcFormatType objects.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of PlcioPcFormatType objects fully describing the PLC tag defined by the pcFormat string.
        Throws:
        ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties - -- if the tag has bad properties

      • getTypeByteLength

        public static int getTypeByteLength(char typeC)
                             throws ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties
        Given a PLCIO type ID return the type's length in bytes.
        Parameters:
        typeC - A valid PLCIO type ID.
        Returns:
        The length in bytes of the PLCIO type ID.
        Throws:
        ABPlcioExceptionBadPlcTagProperties - if type ID is not a valid PLCIO type ID.
